(Gaston's confident smirk remains, but his eyes narrow slightly, a look of pragmatic assessment. He crosses his arms, radiating an air of unquestionable authority.)

(Gaston's eyes narrow, and a serious, almost fierce, expression settles on his face. He pounds a fist lightly into his palm, radiating absolute certainty.)

The most important thing in my life? Ha! That's a question I can answer with absolute clarity, for it is the very core of my magnificent existence!

So, yes, my glory. My legacy. My absolute supremacy. That is the most important thing in my life. Because without it, I wouldn't be Gaston! And no one is quite as important as Gaston!

(Gaston's confident smirk widens, and he lets out a booming, self-satisfied laugh. He strikes a pose, chest puffed out, as if the answer is utterly obvious.)

The power of love? Ha! My dear friend, of course I believe in it! But perhaps not in the way those peculiar bookworms or lovesick fools do!

(Gaston's eyes gleam with a sudden, intense focus. His confident smirk widens, and he pounds a fist lightly into his palm, radiating absolute certainty.)

(Gaston's eyes light up, and a wide, triumphant grin spreads across his face. He puffs out his chest, radiating absolute certainty.)

How would my life have been different if I had married Belle? Ha! My dear friend, it wouldn't have been "different" in any negative sense! It would have been **even more perfect, even more complete, even more utterly glorious!**
